item.title: ‘Risk of cardiac arrest, condition critical’: Doctors on farmer leader Dallewal as fast-unto-death enters Day 27 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Doctors Warn of Cardiac Arrest Risk as Farmer Leader Dallewal Enters Day 27 of Hunger Strike

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, currently on a hunger strike for 27 days, is in critical condition at the Khanauri border protest site.

  • Dallewal is 70 years old and is demanding a legal guarantee for Minimum Support Price (MSP) on crops.
  • Doctors have stated he is at risk of cardiac arrest and multi-organ failure due to his prolonged fasting.
  • His condition shows signs of severe weakness, with symptoms affecting his nervous system and vital organs.
  • On December 26, symbolic hunger strikes will be organized at various levels to support his cause.
  • The farmers continue to protest at border points following failed attempts to march to Delhi.
“He is hemodynamically unstable... He is at risk of cardiac arrest and his condition is critical,” the doctor said.

This situation raises concerns for the safety and wellbeing of Dallewal and highlights ongoing issues related to farmer rights and agricultural policies.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi's special food recommendation as he enjoys family lunch at Delhi restaurant - The Times of India
item.description:
Rahul Gandhi's special food recommendation as he enjoys family lunch at Delhi restaurant

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Rahul Gandhi was spotted enjoying a family lunch at a restaurant in Delhi, where he shared his food recommendations with fans and reporters.

  • Rahul Gandhi praised the local cuisine and made specific recommendations to patrons.
  • The outing showcased his personal side, connecting with family and the public.
  • Photos of the event went viral on social media, sparking discussions among supporters and critics alike.
“Good food brings people together.” - Rahul Gandhi

This event reflects Rahul Gandhi's efforts to remain relatable to the public amid political challenges.

item.title: Delhi's AQI turns ‘severe’ at 409 amid GRAP 4 restrictions - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi's Air Quality Index Reaches Severe Levels Amid GRAP 4 Restrictions

Published on: December 22, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

The air quality in Delhi worsened to 'severe' with an AQI reading of 409 as the city continued to face restrictions under GRAP 4 due to deteriorating air conditions.

  • The AQI rose from 370 (very poor) to 409 (severe) in 24 hours.
  • Humidity levels were reported between 68% and 97% amidst foggy conditions.
  • IMD forecasts light rain and cloudy skies for the following day.
  • GRAP 4 restrictions include a ban on construction activities and entry of polluting trucks.
  • Schools are required to shift classes for grades VI-IX and XI to hybrid mode.
“On December 16, the Centre's air quality panel imposed the GRAP IV curbs under the winter air pollution control plan.”

This severe air pollution event not only affects health but also disrupts educational systems and daily life in Delhi.

item.title: In special gesture, Kuwait’s PM personally sees off PM Modi at airport as he leaves for India - The Times of India
item.description:
Kuwait’s Prime Minister Bids Farewell to PM Modi at Airport

Date: [Insert Publication Date] | Source: [Insert Source]

The Prime Minister of Kuwait personally escorted Prime Minister Modi at the airport as he departed for India, marking a significant diplomatic gesture.

  • Kuwait's PM emphasized the strong ties between India and Kuwait.
  • The gesture reflects the growing relationship and cooperation between the two nations.
  • PM Modi expressed gratitude for the warm hospitality received during his visit.
"This is a testament to our flourishing relationship," said PM Modi during his departure.

This personal send-off from Kuwait’s Prime Minister highlights the importance of diplomatic relationships and is a positive reflection of international cooperation.

item.title: 'Leave India where they will even tax your popcorn ...': Startup founder to Indians with high salaries - The Times of India
item.description:
'Leave India where they will even tax your popcorn ...': Startup founder to Indians with high salaries

Date: [Publication Date Here]

Source: [Source Name Here]

This article discusses the challenges faced by Indians with high salaries, including taxation policies that influence their choices about where to live and work.

  • The startup founder highlights the financial burdens imposed on high-income individuals in India.
  • Suggestions are made regarding the potential benefits of relocating to countries with more favorable taxation.
  • The commentary reflects broader sentiments among professionals regarding India's economic environment.
“In India, even popcorn is taxed heavily, making it hard for professionals to manage their finances.”

The discussion raises significant points about the current economic climate in India and its impact on the workforce.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi's Sunday family lunch & a food recommendation amid Parliament scuffle row - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rahul Gandhi's Family Lunch and Food Recommendation Amid Parliament Scuffle Row

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Amid the ongoing row in Parliament, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi shared a glimpse of his Sunday family lunch at New Delhi's iconic Kwality Restaurant, recommending Chole Bhature, a North Indian delicacy, to his followers.

  • Rahul Gandhi celebrated a family lunch alongside his mother Sonia Gandhi, sister Priyanka Gandhi, brother-in-law Robert Vadra, and his niece.
  • He posted recommendations for the restaurant's famous Chole Bhature on his Instagram.
  • The lunch takes place during a turbulent period of political conflict in Parliament.
  • An FIR has been lodged against Rahul Gandhi in connection with a scuffle involving BJP MPs.
  • Two BJP MPs were injured during the altercation following protests staged by NDA and INDIA bloc MPs.
“Family lunch at the iconic Kwality Restaurant. Try the Chole Bhature if you go,” he captioned the post.

The shared images and his food recommendation come at a time when political tensions are high, reflecting the dual public and personal facets of Gandhi's current life.

item.title: Assam man held for killing 1-yr-old daughter, wife, and faking accident - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Assam Man Arrested for Allegedly Killing Wife and Daughter

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A 24-year-old man from Assam was arrested for allegedly killing his one-year-old daughter and wife, then staging their deaths as an accident.

  • The accused, Rois Uddin Barbhuiya, initially claimed the deaths were due to a car accident in the Barak River.
  • Investigation revealed he killed his wife, Heli Begum, and daughter before pushing their car into the river.
  • The bodies were recovered from the river on December 18, prompting further investigation by local police.
  • Barbhuiya's in-laws filed a complaint after finding discrepancies in his account of events.
  • Authorities are investigating the motive behind the alleged killings.
“The locals too said that Barbhuiya had called them after allegedly plunging the car into the river and claimed that he had managed to escape.” - Numal Mahatta, Superintendent of Police

This case raises concerns about domestic violence and the urgent need for protective measures for vulnerable individuals.

item.title: Horrific Bengaluru accident that killed CEO, his family in Volvo sparks debate on road safety - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bengaluru Road Safety Debate Ignited by Family Tragedy

Date: Saturday, 22nd December 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic road accident near Bengaluru claimed the lives of six family members, intensifying discussions around road safety standards and vehicle effectiveness on unsafe roads.

  • The accident involved a Volvo SUV and an Eicher truck on National Highway 48.
  • All six occupants of the Volvo, including CEO Chandram Yegapagol, were killed when the truck overturned onto their vehicle.
  • Debate sparked over the effectiveness of safety features in vehicles compared to reckless driving behaviors.
  • The Union Minister acknowledged a rise in road accidents in India, calling for stricter enforcement of traffic laws.
“This pic is a reminder that being safer on the road is not achieved by a safer car alone. Safe Roads + Safe Driver + Safe Car --> All three are essential for safety.” - DriveSmart

The tragic loss of life in this accident highlights the critical need for improved road safety measures and responsible driving practices.

item.title: Tripura remained backward during Left rule, BJP brought development: Amit Shah - The Hindu
item.description:
Amit Shah Criticizes Left Rule in Tripura, Points to BJP's Development Efforts

Published on: December 22, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Union Home Minister Amit Shah stated that Tripura remained a backward state during the 35 years of Left rule, claiming significant development occurred only after the BJP took power in 2018.

  • Shah emphasized that under communist rule, development was stagnant, with only 2.5% of the population having access to piped drinking water.
  • He highlighted improvements made since BJP assumed power, including 85% access to potable water and free healthcare initiatives.
  • Shah noted significant support extended to rehabilitated Bru tribals, who were displaced due to ethnic violence in Mizoram.
  • The Home Minister assured that rehabilitated individuals received financial support for home construction and have been integrated into the electoral process.
“For 35 years, the communists ruled Tripura. The communists claimed that they worked for the welfare of the poor... but now we are addressing it.”

In conclusion, Amit Shah's statements aim to showcase the contrasts in governance and development between the BJP and the previous Left government in Tripura, emphasizing the positive changes since the BJP took office.

item.title: PM Narendra Modi receives Kuwait's highest honour, 20th international award by a country - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Narendra Modi receives Kuwait's highest honour, 20th international award by a country

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been awarded 'The Order of Mubarak Al Kabeer', Kuwait's highest honour, marking the 20th international award he has received from a country.

  • The Order of Mubarak Al Kabeer is given to foreign Heads of State and royal family members to signify friendship.
  • PM Modi dedicated the honor to the people of India and the strong ties between India and Kuwait.
  • Other notable recipients of this award include former leaders like Bill Clinton and George Bush.
  • Last month, PM Modi received Guyana's highest award, 'The Order of Excellence', during a visit to the country.
“I am honoured to be conferred the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Order by His Highness the Amir of Kuwait, Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al Sabah. I dedicate this honour to the people of India and to the strong friendship between India and Kuwait,” PM Modi posted on X.

This recognition reflects ongoing diplomatic relations and is part of PM Modi's series of prestigious international accolades.

item.title: Cubbon Reads, study trips or design meet-ups, Cubbon Park officials spare none - The News Minute
item.description:
Community Events at Cubbon Park Face Official Disruptions

Publication Date: December 21, 2023
Source: TNM

A series of recent disruptions at Cubbon Park have raised concerns among community groups, following interference by Horticulture Department officials during gatherings.

  • Horticulture officials disrupted a Secret Santa event by confiscating gift-wrapped books and threatened legal action.
  • Cubbon Reads, a weekly book group, reported receiving no prior warning of the requirement for permission for gatherings over 20 people.
  • The Deputy Director clarified that events require a hefty fee and deposit for permission.
  • Multiple community groups reported experiencing similar harassment and inconsistent rules regarding park activities.
  • Notable groups affected include Cubbon Designs and a community for new parents, with reports of arbitrary enforcement of rules.
“Cubbon Park is an absolute boon to us. What a shame to see the place be reduced to just a mere tourist attraction.”

Following these incidents, community members are calling for clearer guidelines and fair treatment in the park, emphasizing its importance as a public space.

item.title: 'Cheap publicity': Congress slams BJP's Navya Haridas for challenging Priyanka Gandhi's victory from Waya - The Times of India
item.description:
Congress Criticizes BJP's Navya Haridas Over Priyanka Gandhi Challenge

Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

The article discusses the recent criticism by Congress directed at BJP's Navya Haridas for her challenge to Priyanka Gandhi's victory in the Wayanad constituency. The debate showcases the fierce political rivalry ahead of upcoming elections.

  • Navya Haridas questioned the legitimacy of Priyanka Gandhi's victory.
  • Congress leaders responded sharply, criticizing BJP's tactics.
  • The situation reflects the high tension in Indian politics as elections approach.
"This is a blatant attempt to undermine our electoral successes," stated a Congress spokesperson.

The incident highlights the ongoing political maneuvering and the charged atmosphere among Indian political parties as they prepare for the next electoral battle.

item.title: With decks cleared for Nitish leadership for 2025 polls, an NDA refrain: ‘Bihar is not Maharashtra’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Nitish Kumar to Lead NDA in 2025 Bihar Assembly Elections

Date: October 2023
Source: Indian Express

In a recent development, the NDA in Bihar has confirmed that Chief Minister Nitish Kumar will lead the coalition for the upcoming Assembly polls scheduled for October-November 2025, dismissing any speculation about changes in leadership.

  • The NDA constituents reaffirm Nitish Kumar's leadership amid discussions of leadership dynamics.
  • Bihar BJP president Dilip Jaiswal emphasized that Nitish will continue to lead in the elections.
  • The NDA plans a comprehensive campaign with Nitish Kumar addressing joint meetings across various districts, starting in January.
  • Other NDA partners in Bihar include Jitan Ram Manjhi’s Hindustani Awam Morcha and Chirag Paswan’s LJP (RV).
  • Historical context shows Nitish's significant role in Bihar politics dating back to 2000.
“The BJP knows that Nitish is indispensable for the NDA... The BJP can only silently wait for him to walk into the sunset,” a state BJP leader remarked.

This clarification from the NDA partners underlines the stability of Nitish Kumar's leadership as they gear up for the elections, marking his enduring influence in Bihar politics.

item.title: ‘Tried to prevent collision’: Trucker booked for Bengaluru accident that killed 6 in SUV blames another vehicle - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Tried to prevent collision’: Trucker booked for Bengaluru accident that killed 6 in SUV blames another vehicle

Date: Saturday

Source: Local News

The Bengaluru rural district police are investigating a tragic accident involving a container truck and an SUV that resulted in the deaths of six family members, including a software company CEO and his two children.

Key Points:

  • The accident occurred near Nelamangala when a truck's container fell onto the Volvo XC90 occupied by Chandram Yegapagol and his family.
  • The truck driver, Arif, claims a blue car abruptly braked, causing him to lose control.
  • Police have secured CCTV footage that seems to support the truck driver's statement.
  • All six victims, including Yegapagol’s wife and children, were on their way to their native village.
  • The family was well-prepared for safety, with Yegapagol recently purchasing the Volvo for its safety features.
  • The incident has garnered significant local attention due to the family’s prominence and their tragic loss.
“Safety was a priority for him. He checked many vehicles before deciding on the Volvo.” - Umesh Murudi, relative

This devastating event highlights the risks associated with road traffic and the importance of driver awareness. The investigation continues as authorities search for the driver of the blue car involved.

item.title: What's Getting Cheaper And Costlier After GST Council Meeting? Check Full List - News18
item.description:
What's Getting Cheaper And Costlier After GST Council Meeting? Check Full List

Date: December 22, 2024 Source: News18

The GST Council's 55th meeting led by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reviewed and made significant changes to GST rates, impacting various goods and services.

  • Reduction in GST on Fortified Rice Kernel (FRK) to 5% to enhance affordability.
  • Full GST exemption on gene therapy to improve accessibility.
  • Exemption for contributions to the Motor Vehicle Accident Fund from GST.
  • No GST on transactions involving vouchers.
  • No GST on penal charges levied by banks and NBFCs for non-compliance.
  • Reduction in pre-deposit for appeals regarding penalty amounts.
“The GST Council aims to provide relief to individuals and streamline compliance,” remarked Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

This meeting signifies an effort to enhance the economic landscape by adjusting tax rates strategically to support various sectors.

item.title: Narendra Modi in Kuwait: PM receives guard of honour on Day 2, lauds India's ties with Gulf nation - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Narendra Modi in Kuwait: PM receives guard of honour on Day 2, lauds India's ties with Gulf nation

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a ceremonial welcome and guard of honour during his official visit to Kuwait, marking the first visit by an Indian PM to the country in 43 years. His discussions with Kuwaiti officials emphasized the bilateral ties, economic partnerships, and cultural connections between the two nations.

  • Modi's visit was at the invitation of the Emir of Kuwait, Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah.
  • He met with the Indian diaspora and participated in cultural and business discussions.
  • Trade and commerce highlighted as key aspects of India-Kuwait relations.
  • Modi emphasized India's growing economy and the presence of 'Made in India' products in Kuwait.
  • He discussed the importance of the Indian community in Kuwait and its contributions to bilateral relations.
“Overall, the bilateral ties are progressing well and if I could say, scaling new heights.” - PM Narendra Modi

The visit aims to strengthen historical ties and explore opportunities for future cooperation in trade, investment, and cultural exchange.
